Class List

java.lang.Object
List
public class List
extends java.lang.Object
Creates a list.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    List​(java.lang.String listName, boolean isOrdered)
    Constructor method.
    List​(List otherList)
    Copy constructor.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void add​(java.lang.String itemName)
    Adds an item to the list and, if necessary, sorts the list alphabetically to reorder the items.
    void clear()
    Clears the list, including the text file.
    void display()
    Displays all items in the list one per line.
    void displayCompact()
    Displays all items in the list in one line.
    java.lang.String getName()
    Returns the list's name
    void importFile​(java.lang.String filePath)
    Reads a text file line by line and imports it into a list.
    void remove​(int pos)
    Removes an item from the list.
    void save()
    Saves the list to a text file with the name specified in the constructor.
    void saveAs​(java.lang.String filePath)
    Saves the list to the specified absolute file path (must be an existing file).

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • List

      public List​(java.lang.String listName, boolean isOrdered)
      Constructor method. Initializes a new list with a name and a filename (list name followed by .txt).
      Parameters:
      listName - the list's name
      isOrdered - specifies if the list will be alphabetically ordered or not.

    • List

      public List​(List otherList)
      Copy constructor. Duplicates a list.
      Parameters:
      otherList - the list to duplicate

  • Method Details

    • add

      public void add​(java.lang.String itemName)
      Adds an item to the list and, if necessary, sorts the list alphabetically to reorder the items.
      Parameters:
      itemName - the name of the item

    • remove

      public void remove​(int pos)
      Removes an item from the list.
      Parameters:
      pos - the item's position (1..n)

    • save

      public void save() throws java.io.IOException
      Saves the list to a text file with the name specified in the constructor. If the file already exists, the list will be appended to the existing contents. The list's title will also be saved if the list is being saved for the first time.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - throws an exception if the file is not found

    • saveAs

      public void saveAs​(java.lang.String filePath) throws java.io.IOException
      Saves the list to the specified absolute file path (must be an existing file). If the file already exists, the list will be appended to the existing contents.
      Parameters:
      filePath - the absolute file path
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - throws an exception if the file is not found

    • clear

      public void clear() throws java.io.IOException
      Clears the list, including the text file.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - throws an exception if the file is not found

    • importFile

      public void importFile​(java.lang.String filePath) throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
      Reads a text file line by line and imports it into a list.
      Parameters:
      filePath - the absolute file path
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - throws an exception if the file is not found

    • displayCompact

      public void displayCompact()
      Displays all items in the list in one line.

    • display

      public void display()
      Displays all items in the list one per line.

    • getName

      public java.lang.String getName()
      Returns the list's name
      Returns:
      the list's name
